title: Ensure log says "no description" if description is empty
description:
The log pane of the VCS tool window shows descriptions for each change. If the description is empty, it shows nothing. It would be great to show "(No description)" instead - ideally in italics, perhaps a different colour, according to style recommendations and feasibility.

Text should also be localisable.

title: Remove annotate icon
description: The annotate action shouldn't have an icon - it needs to accommodate the tick in that space as it is togglable. The tick indicates whether or not the annotations are shown.

title: Add file-specific read-only functions
description:
As per Git integration, allow these operations on a per-editor basis:
* Annotate
* Show diff
* Compare with change/bookmark/tag
* Show history
* Show history for selection

title: Make annotations highlight all lines in the change
description: File annotations in Git highlight all other annotations in the same change in a different background colour. Do the same for Jujutsu file annotations.

title: Check behaviour when using the plugin in a directory that is not a JJ repository
description:
## Problem

The plugin needs to gracefully handle the case where it's used in a directory that is not a Jujutsu repository (no .jj directory found).

## Current Behavior

- JujutsuVcs has a `root` property that auto-discovers .jj directory by searching upward
- Unclear what happens if no .jj directory is found in the project or any parent directories

## Expected Behavior

The plugin should:
1. Detect when no JJ repository is present
2. Either disable itself gracefully or show a helpful message
3. Not throw errors or crash
4. Not show the Jujutsu tool window if not applicable

## Testing Scenarios

- [ ] Open project without .jj directory
- [ ] Check if VCS is properly disabled
- [ ] Verify no errors in IDE logs
- [ ] Ensure Jujutsu tool window doesn't appear
- [ ] Test with project that has Git but not JJ

## Related Code

- `JujutsuVcs.root` property (auto-discovery logic)
- `JujutsuRootChecker` (currently disabled due to API changes)
- VCS detection and initialization

title: File history view (VcsHistoryProvider)
description:
**Priority**: HIGH (Phase 1 - Read-only features)
**Effort**: 2-3 days

## Description
Implement VcsHistoryProvider to show per-file revision history.

## User Experience
- Right-click file → "Show History"
- View all changes that touched the file
- See change IDs, descriptions, dates
- Compare any two revisions

## Implementation
```kotlin
class JujutsuHistoryProvider(private val vcs: JujutsuVcs) : VcsHistoryProvider {
    override fun createSessionFor(filePath: FilePath): VcsHistorySession? {
        // Execute: jj log path/to/file
        // Parse into List<VcsFileRevision>
        // Return JujutsuHistorySession
    }
}
```

## Commands
- `jj log --template=<fields> path/to/file`
- `jj file show -r <change-id> path/to/file`

## Registration
Add to `JujutsuVcs.kt`:
```kotlin
override fun getVcsHistoryProvider() = JujutsuHistoryProvider(this)
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Right-click "Show History" works
- [ ] Shows all revisions for file
- [ ] Change IDs, descriptions, dates displayed
- [ ] Can compare any two revisions
- [ ] Threading: runs on background thread
- [ ] Integrates with IntelliJ history UI

## References
See ROADMAP.md Phase 1 - Read-only Features
See VCS_API_REFERENCE.md - VcsHistoryProvider section

title: Revert action
description: Have an action to "revert" a file to the previous state (I probably have the wrong JJ terminology for this). This action should be invocable from editors and from the working copy tool window.

title: Ensure all actions can be configured with shortcuts
description: For example, "annotate" never shows a keyboard shortcut. Ideally, this would reuse the "Annotate" action defined under "VCS".

title: Real-time status updates (auto-refresh)
description:
**Priority**: MEDIUM (Phase 1 - Read-only features)
**Effort**: 1-2 days

## Description
Auto-refresh working copy status when files change on disk.

## User Experience
- File changes appear immediately in tool window
- Status colors update automatically
- No manual refresh needed

## Implementation
```kotlin
class JujutsuFileListener(private val project: Project) : VirtualFileListener {
    override fun contentsChanged(event: VirtualFileEvent) {
        VcsDirtyScopeManager.getInstance(project).fileDirty(event.file)
    }
}
```

## Registration
In `JujutsuVcs.activate()`:
```kotlin
override fun activate() {
    super.activate()
    VirtualFileManager.getInstance().addVirtualFileListener(fileListener, this)
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] File edits trigger automatic refresh
- [ ] File creation triggers refresh
- [ ] File deletion triggers refresh
- [ ] Listener registered in activate()
- [ ] No performance issues with large projects
- [ ] Optional: debouncing for rapid changes

## References
See ROADMAP.md Phase 1 - Read-only Features
See VCS_API_REFERENCE.md - Virtual File Listener

title: File blame/annotation (AnnotationProvider)
description:
**Priority**: MEDIUM (Phase 4 - Complex operations)
**Effort**: 3-5 days

## Description
Show which change introduced each line of code.

## Jujutsu Advantage
Change IDs are stable (don't change on rebase) - better than Git!

## User Experience
- Right-click in editor → "Annotate with Jujutsu"
- Gutter shows change IDs per line
- Hover for full change description
- Click to view change details

## Implementation
```kotlin
class JujutsuAnnotationProvider(private val vcs: JujutsuVcs) : AnnotationProvider {
    override fun annotate(file: VirtualFile): FileAnnotation? {
        // Execute: jj file annotate path
        // Parse line-by-line annotations
        // Return JujutsuFileAnnotation
    }
}
```

## Command
- `jj file annotate path/to/file`

## Registration
```kotlin
override fun getAnnotationProvider() = JujutsuAnnotationProvider(this)
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Right-click "Annotate" works
- [ ] Gutter shows change IDs
- [ ] Hover shows full description
- [ ] Click navigates to change
- [ ] Multi-line changes handled
- [ ] Performance OK for large files

## References
See ROADMAP.md Phase 4 - Complex Operations
See VCS_API_REFERENCE.md - AnnotationProvider

title: Git remote operations (fetch/push)
description:
**Priority**: HIGH (Phase 3 - Remote operations)
**Effort**: 2-3 days

## Description
Fetch and push to Git remotes.

## User Experience
- "Fetch" action in VCS menu
- "Push" action with bookmark selection
- Progress indication
- Show incoming/outgoing changes

## Commands
- `jj git fetch`
- `jj git fetch --remote <name>`
- `jj git push --bookmark <name>`
- `jj git push --all`

## Implementation
```kotlin
// Add to JujutsuCommandExecutor
fun gitFetch(remote: String? = null): CommandResult
fun gitPush(bookmark: String? = null, all: Boolean = false): CommandResult
fun gitRemoteList(): CommandResult
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Fetch from Git remote
- [ ] Push bookmark to remote
- [ ] Push all bookmarks option
- [ ] Select which remote to fetch/push
- [ ] Progress indication
- [ ] Error handling for auth issues
- [ ] Success/failure notifications

## References
See ROADMAP.md Phase 3 - Remote Operations

title: Rebase/squash operations UI
description:
**Priority**: LOW (Phase 4 - Complex operations)
**Effort**: 4-6 days

## Description
Visual rebase, squash, and split operations.

## Commands
- `jj rebase -r <change-id> -d <destination>`
- `jj squash`
- `jj squash -r <change-id>`
- `jj split`

## User Experience
- Select change in log → "Rebase onto..."
- "Squash into Parent" action
- "Split Change" with interactive mode

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Rebase action from context menu
- [ ] Select destination change
- [ ] Squash action available
- [ ] Split with UI for selecting changes
- [ ] Preview of result
- [ ] Error handling for conflicts

## References
See ROADMAP.md Phase 4 - Complex Operations

title: Conflict resolution UI
description:
**Priority**: HIGH (Phase 4 - Complex operations)
**Effort**: 3-4 days

## Description
Detect and resolve merge conflicts in working copy.

## User Experience
- Conflicted files show RED in tree
- Right-click → "Show Conflict" opens 3-way merge editor
- "Mark Resolved" action
- Gutter indicators for conflict regions

## Implementation
```kotlin
class JujutsuMergeProvider(private val vcs: JujutsuVcs) : MergeProvider {
    override fun loadRevisions(file: VirtualFile): MergeData {
        // Parse conflict markers
        // Return base, ours, theirs
    }
}
```

## Conflict Detection
```kotlin
fun isConflicted(file: VirtualFile): Boolean {
    return content.contains("<<<<<<<") &&
           content.contains("=======") &&
           content.contains(">>>>>>>")
}
```

## Registration
```kotlin
override fun getMergeProvider() = JujutsuMergeProvider(this)
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Conflicted files show RED
- [ ] 3-way merge editor works
- [ ] "Mark Resolved" action
- [ ] FileStatus.CONFLICTED
- [ ] Handles Jujutsu conflict format
- [ ] Multiple conflicts in same file

## References
See ROADMAP.md Phase 4 - Complex Operations
See VCS_API_REFERENCE.md - MergeProvider

title: Size the description text box
description: In the working copy tool window, allow the description text box to grow until it (and the buttons below it) take up half of the height of the tool window OR stretch as far as possible without the change tree needing to have scroll bars, whichever is greater.

title: Settings/Configuration UI
description:
**Priority**: MEDIUM (Phase 2 - Simple write operations)
**Effort**: 1-2 days

## Description
Configurable panel for plugin settings.

## User Experience
- Settings → Version Control → Jujutsu
- Configure JJ executable path
- UI preferences

## Settings
- JJ executable path (with file picker)
- Auto-refresh enabled/disabled
- Show change IDs in short or long format
- Number of changes to show in log (default 50)

## Implementation
```kotlin
@State(name = "JujutsuConfiguration",
       storages = [Storage("jujutsu.xml")])
class JujutsuConfiguration : PersistentStateComponent<JujutsuConfigState>
```

## Registration
```xml
<projectConfigurable
    id="vcs.Jujutsu"
    displayName="Jujutsu"
    instance="in.kkkev.jjidea.settings.JujutsuConfigurable"
    parentId="project.propVCSSupport.Mappings" />
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Settings panel under Version Control → Jujutsu
- [ ] JJ executable path configurable
- [ ] Auto-refresh toggle
- [ ] Settings persist across restarts
- [ ] Validation for executable path
- [ ] Apply/Reset buttons work

## References
See ROADMAP.md Phase 2 - Simple Write Operations
See VCS_API_REFERENCE.md - Configuration section

title: Display bookmarks as tags in log view commit list
description:
**Problem:**
The log view doesn't visually display bookmarks next to commits like the Git plugin shows branches. Bookmarks are Jujutsu's equivalent to Git branches and should be prominently visible in the log.

**Current Behavior:**
- Log view shows commit graph and descriptions
- No visual indication of which commits have bookmarks
- Users can't quickly identify bookmarked commits

**Expected Behavior:**
- Show bookmark names as colored tags/labels next to commit descriptions (like Git branches)
- Display bookmark icon/indicator
- Use distinct colors for different bookmarks (similar to Git's branch coloring)
- Show multiple bookmarks if a commit has several
- Distinguish between local and remote bookmarks

**Example (Git behavior):**
```
* abc1234 (main, origin/main) Commit message
* def5678 (feature-branch) Another commit
```

**Implementation Notes:**
- JujutsuLogProvider.readAllRefsInternal() already reads bookmarks
- Bookmarks are returned as VcsRef with type BOOKMARK
- Need to ensure refs are properly rendered in the log UI
- May need to configure VcsLogRefManager.BOOKMARK type for proper display

**Related:**
- Issue #18: Bookmark management UI (mentions showing bookmarks but not specifically about visual display)
- Issue #5: Bookmark management system

**Priority:** HIGH - Bookmarks are essential for navigation in Jujutsu workflows

title: Run a fuller suite of tests in the workflow
description:
CI barely runs any tests - anything dependent on the plugin framework classes seems to be excluded - Claude thinks for dependency reasons.

We need to fix this, so that the dependencies are available in CI and all tests can run.

title: Git remote management UI
description:
**Priority**: MEDIUM (Phase 3 - Remote operations)
**Effort**: 1-2 days

## Description
Manage Git remotes (list, add, remove, rename).

## User Experience
- Settings or separate tab: "Remotes"
- List all configured remotes
- Add new remote with name and URL
- Remove remote
- Rename remote

## Commands
- `jj git remote list`
- `jj git remote add <name> <url>`
- `jj git remote remove <name>`
- `jj git remote rename <old> <new>`

## Implementation
```kotlin
// Add to JujutsuCommandExecutor
fun gitRemoteList(): CommandResult
fun gitRemoteAdd(name: String, url: String): CommandResult
fun gitRemoteRemove(name: String): CommandResult
fun gitRemoteRename(oldName: String, newName: String): CommandResult
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] List all remotes
- [ ] Add remote with name and URL
- [ ] Remove remote
- [ ] Rename remote
- [ ] Validation for remote names and URLs
- [ ] Integration with fetch/push actions

## References
See ROADMAP.md Phase 3 - Remote Operations

title: Create marketing materials for plugin
description:
Create comprehensive marketing materials for the Jujutsu VCS IntelliJ IDEA plugin to prepare for wider distribution and promotion.

## Tasks

- [ ] Design a plugin logo/icon
  - Should represent both JJ and IntelliJ
  - Needs to work at various sizes (16x16, 32x32, 128x128, etc.)
  - Should be distinctive and recognizable

- [ ] Write compelling plugin description
  - Short description (1-2 sentences) for JetBrains Marketplace
  - Long description with key features and benefits
  - Highlight JJ's unique "describe-first" workflow
  - Emphasize native IntelliJ integration

- [ ] Create screenshots
  - Tool window showing changes view
  - Diff viewer in action
  - Describe/New Change workflow demonstration
  - File status coloring and tree view
  - Context menu and toolbar actions

- [ ] Create animated GIF/video demo (optional but recommended)
  - Show typical workflow: describe → make changes → new change
  - Highlight key features in action

- [ ] Update README.md with better presentation
  - Add logo/banner image
  - Add screenshots
  - Improve feature list with visuals

- [ ] Prepare JetBrains Marketplace listing
  - All required metadata
  - Proper categorization
  - Keywords for discoverability

## Context

Current state:
- Plugin is functional with core features implemented
- No visual marketing materials exist yet
- Description is technical/developer-focused rather than user-focused
- Need materials before public release/promotion

title: Change graph visualization
description:
**Priority**: MEDIUM (Phase 4 - Complex operations)
**Effort**: 5-7 days

## Description
Graphical display of change ancestry showing parent-child relationships.

## User Experience
- Visual graph in log view
- See concurrent changes
- Understand rebase/split/merge history
- Click nodes to navigate

## Implementation Options
1. Custom renderer in JujutsuLogPanel
2. VcsLogProvider integration (advanced)

## Commands
- `jj log --template=<fields including parents>`
- Parse parent relationships
- Build graph structure

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Visual graph in log view
- [ ] Shows parent-child relationships
- [ ] Distinguishes first/second parent
- [ ] Click node to view details
- [ ] Handles complex rebase histories
- [ ] Performance OK for 1000+ changes

## References
See ROADMAP.md Phase 4 - Complex Operations

title: Remove or replace 'Not in any branch' message in log view details
description:
**Problem:**
The log view details pane (right-hand side) shows "Not in any branch" for all commits. This is incorrect for Jujutsu, which uses bookmarks instead of branches, and the Git concept of "current branch" doesn't apply.

**Current Behavior:**
- Details pane always shows: "Not in any branch"
- Message is misleading since JJ doesn't use Git-style branches

**Expected Behavior:**
Option 1 (Simple): Remove this field entirely
Option 2 (Better): Show bookmark information if the commit has bookmarks:
  - "Bookmarks: main, feature-x" (if commit has bookmarks)
  - Remove the field entirely if no bookmarks (don't show "no bookmarks")

Option 3 (Best): Show working copy indicator:
  - "@ Working Copy" (if this is the working copy commit)
  - "Bookmarks: main, feature-x" (if commit has bookmarks)
  - Remove field if neither applies

**Implementation Notes:**
- JujutsuLogProvider likely provides this through getCurrentBranch() which returns null
- May need to customize the log details panel rendering
- Could provide bookmark info through VcsLogProvider methods

**Related:**
- Issue #30: Display bookmarks as tags in log view
- JujutsuLogEntry has isWorkingCopy property that could be used

**Priority:** MEDIUM - Cosmetic issue but misleading to users

title: Bookmark management UI
description:
**Priority**: HIGH (Phase 2 - Simple write operations)
**Effort**: 2-3 days

## Description
Create/delete/rename/move bookmarks (Jujutsu's version of branches).

## User Experience
- Bookmarks shown in log view
- Right-click change → "Create Bookmark Here"
- Right-click bookmark → "Delete Bookmark"
- Right-click bookmark → "Rename Bookmark"
- Right-click bookmark → "Move to Change..."

## Implementation
Add to `JujutsuCommandExecutor`:
```kotlin
fun bookmarkCreate(name: String, changeId: String): CommandResult
fun bookmarkDelete(name: String): CommandResult
fun bookmarkRename(oldName: String, newName: String): CommandResult
fun bookmarkSet(name: String, changeId: String): CommandResult
fun bookmarkList(): CommandResult
```

## Commands
- `jj bookmark create <name> -r <change-id>`
- `jj bookmark delete <name>`
- `jj bookmark rename <old> <new>`
- `jj bookmark set <name> -r <change-id>`
- `jj bookmark list`

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Create bookmark from context menu
- [ ] Delete bookmark from context menu
- [ ] Rename bookmark action
- [ ] Move bookmark to different change
- [ ] Bookmarks shown in log view
- [ ] Current bookmark highlighted
- [ ] Validation for bookmark names

## References
See ROADMAP.md Phase 2 - Simple Write Operations

title: Improved describe command with validation
description:
**Priority**: HIGH (Phase 2 - Simple write operations)
**Effort**: 1 day

## Description
Enhance the existing "Describe" button with better validation and feedback.

## Current Status
- ✅ Describe button exists
- ⚠️ Needs validation and error handling

## User Experience
- Validate description not empty
- Show error if jj describe fails
- Success notification
- Clear description field after success (optional)

## Implementation
Add validation to existing JujutsuToolWindowPanel describe handler.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Validates description not empty/whitespace
- [ ] Shows error notification on failure
- [ ] Shows success notification
- [ ] Preserves description on failure
- [ ] Updates current change display after success

## References
See ROADMAP.md Phase 2 - Simple Write Operations

title: Show formatted change IDs in log view details pane
description:
**Problem:**
The log view details pane (right-hand side) currently shows the commit ID but not the change ID. When viewing a commit, users need to see the change ID prominently since that's the primary identifier in Jujutsu.

**Current Behavior:**
- Right-hand pane shows "Commit: <hash>" 
- No change ID visible
- No formatting (bold/color) applied to identifiers

**Expected Behavior:**
- Show change ID prominently: "Change: qpvuntsm" with formatting
  - Short prefix ("qp") in bold with highlight color
  - Remainder ("vuntsm") in muted color
- Optionally also show full commit ID below
- Use the same formatting as elsewhere in the UI (JujutsuCommitFormatter)

**Implementation Notes:**
- Likely need to customize the log view details pane rendering
- Apply JujutsuCommitFormatter.format() and toHtml() for consistent styling
- May need to extend VcsLogProvider or customize the details panel

**Priority:** HIGH - Change IDs are the primary way users interact with Jujutsu

title: New change command with options
description:
**Priority**: HIGH (Phase 2 - Simple write operations)
**Effort**: 1-2 days

## Description
Enhance "New Change" button to support creating change with description and options.

## Current Status
- ✅ "New" button exists
- ⚠️ Creates empty change, no description option

## User Experience
- Dialog: "Create new change"
- Optional description field
- Option: Create after current change vs. after parent
- Success notification with new change ID

## Implementation
```kotlin
fun createNewChange(description: String?, after: String?) {
    val args = mutableListOf("new")
    if (description != null) args.addAll(listOf("-m", description))
    if (after != null) args.addAll(listOf("-A", after))
    vcs.commandExecutor.execute(args)
}
```

## Commands
- `jj new` - Create new change after @
- `jj new -m "desc"` - Create with description
- `jj new -A <change-id>` - Create after specific change

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Dialog for new change options
- [ ] Optional description field
- [ ] Optional "after" change selection
- [ ] Success notification
- [ ] Refreshes changes view
- [ ] Updates current change display

## References
See ROADMAP.md Phase 2 - Simple Write Operations

title: Fix the Github plugin repository
description: Installation instructions refer to https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kkkev/jj-idea/main/updatePlugins.xml but this doesn't exist. Ensure that this link is correct and that the build process updates this file so that users can update automatically.

title: File ignoring support (.gitignore)
description:
**Priority**: MEDIUM (Phase 2 - Simple write operations)
**Effort**: 1-2 days

## Description
Support .gitignore for excluding files from VCS.

## User Experience
- Ignored files grayed out in tree
- Right-click → "Add to .gitignore"
- Right-click → "Remove from .gitignore"

## Implementation
```kotlin
class JujutsuIgnoredFileProvider {
    fun isIgnored(file: VirtualFile): Boolean {
        // Read .gitignore patterns
        // Check if file matches
    }
}
```

## Integration
- Use `ChangelistBuilder.processIgnoredFile(file)`
- Custom FileStatus for ignored files

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Reads .gitignore patterns
- [ ] Ignored files grayed out
- [ ] "Add to .gitignore" action
- [ ] "Remove from .gitignore" action
- [ ] Respects .gitignore hierarchy
- [ ] Updates when .gitignore changes

## Note
Jujutsu uses Git's .gitignore format automatically.

## References
See ROADMAP.md Phase 2 - Simple Write Operations

title: Default working copy tree to expanded
description: In the working copy tool window, default all nodes to expanded

title: Fix slow operation when showing annotations
description:
When showing annotations, this error occurs periodically:
```
2025-12-07 20:52:50,921 [  11883]   WARN - #c.i.o.a.i.Utils - 1344 ms to fillMenu@EditorPopup
2025-12-07 20:53:02,523 [  23485] SEVERE - #c.i.u.SlowOperations - Slow operations are prohibited on EDT. See SlowOperations.assertSlowOperationsAreAllowed javadoc.
```
